Module com.javafx.brick_javafx
Package BrickDestroy.Models

Class Player

java.lang.Object
BrickDestroy.Models.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Mobile
public class Player extends Object implements Mobile
A model class that defines the player data and behaviour.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(javafx.geometry.Point2D ballPoint, int width, int height, javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle container)
      Constructor to initialize the player data and make the player rectangle.
      Parameters:
      ballPoint - the initial ball point spawned in the game.
      width - the width of the player rectangle to be created.
      height - the height of the player rectangle to be created.
      container - this represents the screen dimension.

  • Method Details

    • makeRectangle

      private javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle makeRectangle(int width, int height)
      A method to generate a rectangle that represents the player in game.
      Parameters:
      width - the width of the player rectangle to be created.
      height - the height of the player rectangle to be created.
      Returns:
      a rectangle object.

    • collideBall

      public boolean collideBall(Ball ball)
      A method that checks if the player collides with the ball.
      Parameters:
      ball - the ball in the game.
      Returns:
      true if ball collides with player, else false.

    • move

      public void move()
      A method to handle player movement by adding velocity into x coordinate while y coordinate remains.
      Specified by:
      move in interface Mobile

    • moveLeft

      public void moveLeft()
      When user press A key, this method will set the velocity to negative.

    • moveRight

      public void moveRight()
      When user press D key, this method will set the velocity to positive.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      When user did not press any key, this method will set the velocity to 0.

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo(javafx.geometry.Point2D position)
      A method to reset and move the player rectangle to the initial spawn point.
      Specified by:
      moveTo in interface Mobile
      Parameters:
      position - the initial spawn point.
